div.p: Due to the COVID-19 social distancing guidelines, the April 2020 Scott City R-1 Board of Education meeting was held virtually and was digitally recorded. The video of the meetings can be found below:
April 18th, 2020
Notice for Parents and Guardians,

After weeks of thought and guidance from state officials we have been advised to move our graduation date from May 17th. Our new graduation date will be June 21st. If for some reason we are forced to not have graduation on June 21st, graduation will then be held on July 26th. We are truly sorry for any inconvenience this may cause, but we are still committed to honoring our seniors.
Lance Amick
April 15, 2020
Parents and Guardians,

Although the school building has closed, education will continue. After much thought and listening to other schools statewide we have decided on grading procedures for the second semester. We will use students’ third quarter grade as their semester grade. However, all students will have a chance to improve their third quarter grade from April 15th-May 8th. On May 9th all grades will be final. During the April 15th -May 8th window it will be the students’ responsibility to contact their instructors via email to let them know their wishes to improve their grade. Their instructors' email addresses are on the district's website at scr1.org.

div.p: Do you know of a child that is ready for kindergarten next year? Please visit https://www.smore.com/pwmha to learn more about SCE Kindergarten Round-Up.
April 13, 2020
Parents and Guardians,
As schools will be closed for the remainder of the school year, I know you have many questions. Hopefully those will be answered below.

Although we will not be at school, we plan to continue to find ways to educate our students until our normal end of the year date. Packets for reading and math for grades 5-8 are located outside the elementary entrance. Students may also log into reading plus and study island to find assignments from their teachers. Many teachers also have google classrooms. Students may also log into the google classroom to find assignments and messages from teachers.

a.aria-label: Read more: MS Principal Update - April 13, 2020

p.a: Read more: MS Principal Update - April 13, 2020

div.p: April 10, 2020
Parents and Guardians,
We are devastated as educators regarding Governor Parsons closing schools for the remainder of the year. I hope some of the items below will answer some of your questions.

div.h2: Information from the Middle School Principal
div.p: Dear Parents/Guardians,
Topics: Educational Resources
Your child’s health and education is our utmost priority. Please find below a list of resources and recommendations that your child can do while school is not in session.

p.a: Click here for a list of middle school resources.

p.img: Scott City is currently a test site for the ACT, and is open for registrations for the next testing date. You can now sign up for the June 13th ACT test, with the registration deadline being May 8th. Click here to register for the ACT.

div.p: For those students interested, you can also sign up for the June 6th SAT test, with the registration deadline being May 8th. Click here to register for the SAT.
Click here to visit the Counseling Center page.
The date for high school graduation has been changed from May 17 to June 21.
Tune into KFVS-12, KGMO, or KZIM for school closings due to inclement weather. RamAlerts are also sent as phone calls or text messages to your cell phone using SchoolMessenger.
If you wish to anonymously report an instance of bullying, please use the following link and fill out the form. Scott City Anonymous Bully Report
